meanings.definition: A system of telecommunications for sending text-based messages electronically.
meanings.sent1: The company used telex to send important messages to their overseas partners.
meanings.sent2: I received a telex from the office with the latest updates.
meanings.sent3: The telex machine beeped loudly, surprising everyone in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, telex machines are like ancient relics of communication.
meanings.sent5: The telex system revolutionized how messages were transmitted across long distances.

meanings.definition: To send a message using the telex system.
meanings.sent1: They decided to telex the contract details to the client for quick confirmation.
meanings.sent2: I will telex the report to headquarters as soon as it's ready.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would telex his cat to come home for dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her words telexed a sense of urgency that couldn't be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The urgency of the situation prompted him to telex the message without delay.
